wikipedia_page.main: George Henry Robinson (1878 – March 1945) was an English professional footballer who played as a half back for Nottingham Forest and Bradford City.

He joined Bradford City in June 1903, becoming one of the club's first professional players. He was a "popular figure" and was elected by his teammates to serve as vice-captain to both Johnny McMillan and Fred Halliday. He played in City's first ever Football League match on 1 September 1903, against Grimsby Town, playing as centre-half in that game. He spent most of his time with City playing as a half back. He retired due to injury in 1907, having made 118 league and 11 FA Cup appearances. In 1909, Bradford City gave him a benefit match (shared with George Robinson).Frost, p. 135 That same year he returned to football, playing with Aberdeen until 1912.
